section.heading: Board to Set Procedures.
section.text: The local board shall develop and, with the approval of the State Board, establish and enforce procedures and methods to:

para.text: Maintain order throughout the canvass; and

section.heading: Public Inspection of Ballots and Other Documents.
section.text: Observers and challengers are allowed to visually inspect ballots, provisional ballot applications, and absentee ballot envelopes, and the like, at a reasonable distance, but may not touch them.

section.heading: Food and Beverages.
section.text: Food and beverages are prohibited in the counting center.

section.heading: Distractions.
section.text: Conversations and other activities that interfere with or distract the board's staff are prohibited.

para.text: In General. At the start of the canvass, the board shall generally instruct the staff, the public, and the media on the:
The need to maintain order during the canvass;
The distance that must be maintained while inspecting ballots;
The prohibition against food and beverages;
The prohibition against noise and distractions;
The board's authority to maintain order throughout the canvass;
The locations of telephones and restrooms; and
The board shall post written notices in and around the counting center that instruct the public and the media of the conduct required in the counting center.
The notice shall include each of the items specified in §B(1)—(5) of this regulation.

section.heading: Security Guards.
section.text: The board may arrange for one or more security guards to:

para.text: Be present from the start until the end of the canvass; and
Assist the board in maintaining order during the canvass.
